duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide overall direction, prioritize critical issues, and support the team to ensure that work is completed accurately and with quality according to scheduled deadlines, priorities, and overall goals.
Motivate associates through coaching, mentoring, and evaluation.
Improve GSD processes in collaboration with Methodology & Knowledge Mgt, etc. based on understanding of product direction/changes and lessons learned.
Drive innovation, best practices, and achievement of strategic objectives.
Responsible for associate hiring, performance management, and professional development activities, training, and associate engagement.
Participate in the definition of the GIC implementation strategy.
Responsible for client relationship/expectation management and the Project team's ability to deliver client requirements within project deadlines and budget.
Support communications on methodology and business process improvements within the Global Integration Center and to partner teams.
Thrive in a structured environment where you set priorities, organize your day, multi-task, change direction, and provide prompt follow-up.
Executes on continuous improvement initiatives across the GSD Team. Acts as a change leader.
Responsible for staffing and optimizing resources in the team for efficiency and maximum productivity and utilization.
Work collaboratively with other departments to ensure alignment, drive quality and client satisfaction.
Be a leader! Motivate associates while providing continuous feedback on performance and coaching. Develop team members' careers and coordinate additional training as needed with leadership support.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree -> Required. Graduate Degree -> Preferred. Global Payroll Certification -> Preferred. Workday, Oracle, or SAP Integration Certification -> Preferred
